channel.title: Made For This with Jennie Allen
channel.description:
Jennie Allen is the 2x New York Times bestselling author of 'Find Your People' and 'Get Out Of Your Head'. She is also the founder and visionary of IF:Gathering. She is a passionate leader following God's call on her life to catalyze a generation to live what they believe. Jennie has a Masters in Biblical Studies from Dallas Theological Seminary and lives in Dallas, Texas, with her husband, Zac, and their four children.
________

SHORT. FUN. TRUTH. REAL CONVERSATION ABOUT THE STRUGGLES WE ARE FACING AND THE GOD THAT SETS US FREE.

Two episodes release each week - one episode of Jennie teaching and one interview.

item.title: Conflict Zones, the CIA, and Listening to God with Jamie Winship
item.description:
This is part 1 of our 3-part interview series with Jamie Winship. Jamie has spent much of his life living with his family in conflict zones around the world. Listen as Jennie and Jamie go more in depth into the definition of identity and who God has made us to be, how our identity informs our calling, and how to bring your identity into your vocation.

Join Made For This+ to listen to exclusive episodes and curated podcast playlists you can’t hear anywhere else | jennieallen.supportingcast.fm

item.title: Hearing God's Voice
item.description:
The reason we need to be clear on hearing God’s voice about our identity is because no one will shape our identity more than God if we let Him. Hear Jennie share how to build trust with God, dive into scripture, and enjoy spending time with Him.

item.title: How to Have Healthy Relationships with Dr. Alison Cook
item.description:
This is part 3 of our 3-part interview series with Dr. Alison Cook. Dr. Cook is a psychologist who has helped women, ministry leaders, couples, and families learn how to heal painful emotions, forge healthy relationships, and fully live out their God-given potential. Listen as she and Jennie talk about how past wounds can lead to unhealthy relationships and how to counter that.

Part 1 of this interview series: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/made-for-this-with-jennie-allen/id1466667116?i=1000582501565

Part 2 of this interview series: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/made-for-this-with-jennie-allen/id1466667116?i=1000583269319

item.title: Dependence on God in the Midst of Depression with Zac Allen
item.description:
This week we’re sharing a replay of a candid conversation Jennie had with her husband, Zac, about his nine month season of depression that hit him in a sudden wave. Hear about the reasons we struggle with depression, the three phases of depression Zac went through, and helpful resources if you find yourself in a similar season. Our hope is that you or the people you love will not feel alone.

item.title: Self-Forgetful vs. Selfless
item.description:
One of the deepest desires in our generation is for there to be better emotional wellness and mental health. We want to use this season to attack the idea of “identity” and help you get to a place where you can look at where you are and admit when you’re not doing great. Learn how becoming self-aware is the starting point to knowing we need God.

item.title: The Chapter I Wish I Had Included in ‘Get Out Of Your Head’
item.description:
This whole season comes from a super personal place. During more than 3 months off from working, creating, and producing, Jennie was able to spend time with God and the people she loves most. Over this time, she learned that there are some additions she would make to her bestselling book, Get Out Of Your Head, if she were to write it today.

item.title: The First Step in Knowing Who You Are
item.description:
When we take inventory of all the pieces that make us whole, it is unlikely they are all thriving at the same time. In this episode, we talk about how to seek God’s guidance when we feel lacking, and how to trust Him with a child-like faith. We all feel pressure to a different degree. When that happens, our identities can become tied to our achievements. But know this: God is after a relationship with you. He doesn’t want you to do more or achieve more.

TIMESTAMPS:
2 Questions to Ask God (16:39)
How to have a Child-Like Faith (17:32)

item.title: Are You Ok? — Season 12 Coming October 4th
item.description:
Are you ok?
We all would love to have a quick answer when someone asks us this, but life is not that simple. When we realize that our identity and who we are is made up of a combination of many parts that are feeling and experiencing different things at a given time, we are able to work on the different parts without sabotaging the whole. Join us for 12 weeks, 24 episodes where we take an honest look at the parts of you and the God who makes us whole. I want to walk beside you in this tension and remind you what Scripture tells us that God wants for us. Forward this to your friends, gather your people, and process this in community.

Find out more about this Identity Season | jennieallen.com/blog/identity

item.title: Life is Meant to be Lived Together
item.description:
Because we are loved by God, we should be people who love others well. In this episode, learn how to show up for your people and see your own needs get met in the process. You can also get a peek inside Jennie’s small group from her friends Ellen Lee and Carla Moss and hear how they live connected.

Get your copy of Find Your People: findyourpeoplebook.com

Conflict is part of all relationships, and in order to grow closer to others, we have to stick with people even when they hurt us. item.title: FYP #22 Deep
item.description:
Choosing to live life on mission with others in community should be one of our primary decision makers. Whether it’s choosing what job to take, what college to attend, or church you’re going to join, who you do life with should be the main factor in deciding what you do, how you do it, and why you do it.

item.title: FYP #20 An Update from Afghanistan with “S”
item.description:
This is one of the most incredible stories you’ll ever hear. We heard about "S" from our work with Pastor X in the Middle East. She was outside of Afghanistan when the Taliban were taking over, and she was determined to get back in because of her love of God and love of people. She risked her life to do this interview, and we know you’ll never be the same.

GIVE to Global Catalytic Ministries here: https://app.etapestry.com/onlineforms/GlobalCatalyticMinistriesInc/GCMdonations.html

Download the Afghanistan 7 Day Prayer Guide: ifgathering.com/afghanistan

item.title: FYP #17 What Our Confessional Community Looks Like with Ann Voskamp and Jessica Honegger
item.description:

item.title: We're lonelier than ever. This is why.
item.description:
My new book Find Your People releases 2/22/22! In a world that’s both more connected and more isolating than ever before, we’re often tempted to do life alone, whether because we’re so busy or because relationships feel risky and hard. But science confirms that consistent, meaningful connection with others has a powerful impact on our well-being. We are meant to live known and loved.

item.title: What's Happening in Afghanistan? Stories from Believers on the Ground with Jennie and Pastor X
item.description:
What we are witnessing right now is the decimation of the country and people of Afghanistan. The Taliban has a hit list of known Christians that they are targeting to hunt down and kill. But these believers are not hopeless... I've had 3 conversations this week with my friend Pastor X and his team that have changed my faith. History has shown that persecution grows the church and you guys.. these Jesus followers on the ground in Afghanistan are still on mission, hopeful, and willing to die for their faith.

item.title: NTP Ep. 17 - The 7 Questions You Need to Ask Yourself about Fear
item.description:
We all have hurts, bitterness, baggage and what I want to do today is take an honest look at what that is. I want to unpack the things that are causing us to fear.

1. What hurt are you holding on to and why?
2. How do you think Jesus feels about your pain or disappointment?
3. Is there value in going to difficult places? If so, what is it?
4. How have you seen Jesus redeem some of your darkest times?
5. How has that strengthened your hope and trust in Him?
6. Is there any other hurt or disappointment that you’re avoiding? If so, what is it?
7. How can I love you well right now?

We love this audioBible app called Dwell, sign up here: https://dwellapp.io/aff?ref=jennieallen

item.itunes:subtitle:

item.itunes:summary:
We all have hurts, bitterness, baggage and what I want to do today is take an honest look at what that is. I want to unpack the things that are causing us to fear.

1. What hurt are you holding on to and why?
2. How do you think Jesus feels about your pain or disappointment?
3. Is there value in going to difficult places? If so, what is it?
4. How have you seen Jesus redeem some of your darkest times?
5. How has that strengthened your hope and trust in Him?
6. Is there any other hurt or disappointment that you’re avoiding? If so, what is it?
7. How can I love you well right now?

We love this audioBible app called Dwell, sign up here: https://dwellapp.io/aff?ref=jennieallen

item.description:

Today we are going to talk about how trusting God means we can live in both the hard times and the good times. If you ever wonder if following God just means that life will always be hard, join me today.

item.description:

This episode just might change your life.

item.title: Peace over Chaos - Season 7 starts Feb. 2nd!
item.description: NEW YEAR, NEW SEASON and we missed you!! If there’s ever been a time where we need people to grab us by the shoulders and tell us what is true and what is real, it is right now. We don’t need big fancy words to get us through our days, we need to go back to the simple and pure things God has given us to stay close to Him and love people well. There is a way out of the chaos in our minds, the fear, the confusion and lack of vision - it’s in clinging to our Bibles and knowing what to do next because of it. Let’s spend 10 weeks going back to the basics every single one of us needs to know… things like how to pray, what to do with sin, how to read your Bible, and why we all need to have fun sometimes. These 10 weeks will give you practical steps you can take right now and challenge you to follow God and go deeper with Him.

item.title: BONUS - Stop Hiding Your Gifts with Jo Saxton
item.description:
Now more than ever - it’s time for us to stop hiding who God has made us to be and step into the things he has planned for us. Doing the next thing, loving and leading in a hurting world. It will require us to link arms, it will mean we deal with our hurts, it will mean we take risks that are beyond our own abilities and watch God show up and move beyond our wildest dreams.

You’ve got to read Jo’s new book “Ready to Rise”, find it here: https://www.amazon.com/Ready-Rise-Gather-Community-Influence/dp/B07RK4HL48/ref=nodl_

item.description:
Delight… it’s a funny thing in the midst of this. Have you been honest with God about how you’re doing through this season? I pray you’d get real with Him about where you’re at. You don’t need to do great things to matter, we get to worship a God who says you matter. Enjoy God’s delight over you. Delight in the mundane, in the small things.

item.title: 18 - What Does it Really Mean to Meditate on Truth with Dr. Paul Tripp
item.description:
We’ve spent this season talking about how we can stop our spiraling thoughts… but then what? Where do we go from here? We wake up every morning and we need to not just empty our minds of toxic thoughts, but put new thoughts in their place. Dr. Tripp has pastored me and my family for years with his devotional ‘New Morning Mercies’, it is a must-read… you will love this episode because it will give you simple steps to think new thoughts.

Find Dr. Tripp’s New Morning Mercies here: https://www.amazon.com/New-Morning-Mercies-Gospel-Devotional/dp/1433541386

Follow Dr. Tripp on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pdtripp/

A seriously fun camp for your whole family: https://pine.co.ve/Jennie_9

item.title: 16 - What We All Need to Know About Depression with Zac Allen
item.description:
This episode is for those of you are going through a dark season or you know someone who is struggling because we are going to talk about depression and burn out. We will tell you about a season in our lives when Zac walked through a dark season of depression and what that looked like. Everyone needs to hear what he has to say! Don’t miss this and share with anyone in your life who feels hopeless and is struggling.

Books Zac mentions: ‘Christians Get Depressed Too’ by David Murray and ‘Leading on Empty’ by Wayne Cordeiro

Find Get Out of Your Head book: getoutofyourheadbook.com

item.title: 15 - Complacency vs. Intentionality
item.description:
Do you tend to check out and numb out? We are bombarded with too many problems. What can we do about it? How can we even help? We zone out, check out. Let’s reject passivity and lean into the needs around us - as we fix our eyes on Jesus and throw off the sin and weight that clings to us, we run our races. We have a mission. We’re running after God.

item.title: 14 - The Fight for Justice with Dr. John Perkins
item.description:
Dr Perkins is a civil rights activist, Bible teacher, philosopher, and community developer. He has shaped generations and it is an incredible privilege to have him share his story with us today. He and his wife Vera Mae have spent their lives spreading the love of Christ and seeing communities transform through the John and Vera Mae Perkins Foundation.

Don’t miss his books ‘Let Justice Roll’, ‘He Calls Me Friend’, and his newest book ‘One Blood: Parting Words to the Church on Race and Love’, learn more about Dr Perkins here: https://www.jvmpf.org/

Download the DWELL App: https://dwellapp.io/jennie

item.title: 13 - Victimhood vs. Gratitude
item.description:
There’s something robbing our joy, leaving us defeated and paralyzed and sad. In some degree, all of us are acting like the world is out to get us and we don’t have to live like this. God has given us a way out of our spiraling thoughts. NOTE - there are so many of you are facing unthinkable abuse and wrong, listen to the whole episode… we’re not talking about this. This attitude we’re going to address is the victim mindset that steals the hope and power of God from your circumstances.  

A seriously fun camp for your whole family: https://pine.co.ve/Jennie_7

Find Get Out of Your Head book: getoutofyourheadbook.com

item.description:

item.description:
Are you tired of trying to measure up and matter in life? Self-importance feels so good, it's deep in our bones to crave it and fight for it. We chase it in different ways every day. item.title: 09 - Cynicism vs. Delight
item.description:
Cynicism is the air we breathe and we don’t even notice it. We’ll ask ourselves some questions to see if we struggle with cynical thoughts! There’s a more joyful, more delightful way to live. When we’re cynical, we don’t see our need to be helped! The tool God has given us to fight this is simple. Let’s fight for each other today!

item.title: 08 - ‘Is God real?’ with Julie Manning
item.description:
What if today could be your last? This is a question my dear friend Julie faces every single day. And yet, because she believes God is real and heaven is coming, she lives with unbelievable surrender and joy. We can face our fears and work through them and God will carry us to the other side. Do not miss this conversation.

Get Julie’s incredible book: https://www.amazon.com/My-Heart-Every-Surrendered-Unchanging/dp/1433644045

item.title: 06 - We Need Each Other with Dr. Charles Mugisha
item.description:
We are lonelier than ever and something has to change. You will love this conversation with our dear friend Pastor Charles Mugisha because he will open your eyes to the ways people connect more deeply and intentionally in his country. Pastor Charles is a visionary and the ministry he founded (Africa New Life) serves over 10,000 children in Rwanda. His story will blow you away!

Learn more about Africa New Life: https://www.africanewlife.org

Get Out of Your Head book: getoutofyourheadbook.com

item.title: 03 - Noise vs. Silence
item.description:
"I'll feel better if I stay distracted..." We're starting with NOISE this week because it may be the most obvious spiral we all get stuck in. We live in the noisiest generation to ever live, with more inputs than ever. God has given us everything we need to interrup our spiraling distractedness, but we have to make the choice. Will we choose it? {This episode pairs with chapter 8 of Get Out of Your Head book}

item.title: 02 - How We Train the Mind with Clint Bruce {Navy Seal}
item.description:
I couldn’t think of a better way to kick off season 3 than this conversation with Clint Bruce. Clint was a Navy Seal officer, a professional football player in the NFL, he trains and prepares and equips people to this day. He loves Jesus and has an incredible family! We talk about what it means to train... we can’t just hope for the best in the war for our minds. We train for it and when the need arises, we choose the truth of Scripture. {This episode pairs with chapters 1-6 of Get Out of Your Head Book}

item.title: 01 - You are not a victim to your thoughts.
item.description:
Get ready… Season 3 of the Made for This Podcast is HERE! I wrote Get Out of Your Head because I was sick of the war in my own head and in so many of yours. I pray the whole of humanity reads this and fights back with the God-given weapons we already have. ⁣You are in charge of your thoughts, they are not in charge of you. Let’s fight back together. {This episode pairs with chapters 1-6 of Get Out of Your Head Book}

item.title: Introducing Season 3: Get Out of Your Head
item.description:
SEASON 3 STARTS ON JANUARY 28th!

I hear all the time from people who feel stuck in patterns of frustration and defeat. In my search for a solution, I learned that the greatest spiritual battle of our generation is taking place between our ears. How we think shapes how we live. So it's crucial that we learn how to stop our spinning thoughts and refuse to fall prey to toxic thinking patterns like victimhood, anxiety, and distraction. In Season 3 of the Made for This podcast, we will focus on biblical truth and recent discoveries in neuroscience to show exactly how we can fight the enemies of the mind with the truth of who God is and who He calls us to be. "Be transformed by the renewing of your mind..." This means it's possible.

Get your copy of Get Out of Your Head and read along with us: getoutofyourheadbook.com
